description.narrative: As per November 1, st 2012 an Institutional funding Officer has been recruited for Oxfam Novib Mali Office. Upon taking office, he was assigned as a first duty to develop a fundraising strategy as well as a fundraising calendar. When these two funding strategic documents have been framed and approved, it was discovered that there is no financial resources budgeted for fundraising activities. Therefore, after a thorough review of available programmatic resources, it was agreed that the education program officer will reserve an amount of 10 000 euro for fundraising activities. The budget will be used to: - contribute to co-finance projects where partners #organizations are lead and where the potential donor requires a co-funding - Organize training to Oxfam Novib partners in the area of project formulation, the development of communication and marketing strategies, resource mobilization strategy, budgeting etc; - finance trip visit to donors at country and regional level, - monitor on the field project funded by back donors to in order to ensure that partners are complying to donors #rules and regulations ; - fund induction meeting as soon as donors approve a proposal; Outputs per activities: - contribute to co-finance projects where partners #organizations are lead and where the potential donor requires a co-funding ; Outputs : 2 projects requiring co-funding will be developed and approved by donors for the benefit of local partners - Organize training to Oxfam Novib partners in the area of project formulation, the development of communication and marketing strategies, resource mobilization strategy, budgeting etc; Outputs: 7 partners# organizations will develop two proposals each, 22 participants from local partners will receive training in project formulation, budgeting, 2 counterparts will develop their own fundraising strategy. - finance trip visit to donors at country and regional level, Outputs: 2 filed visits one in Senegal and the other in Niger to get acquainted with regional colleagues and find out how to raise regional resources together - monitor on the field project funded by back donors to in order to ensure that partners are complying to donors #rules and regulations ; Outputs: two filedvisits conducted for the programs My rights my Voice and Comic Relied as well as the project funded by the Dutch Embassy - fund induction meeting as soon as donors approve a proposal; Output: 1 induction meeting organized for local partners Duration: The time frame for this project is from April 1st, 2015 to march 31st, 2016

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam is an international confederation of 17 organizations working together in more than 90 countries. Oxfam International was formed in 1995 by a group of independent non-governmental organizations. Their aim was to work together for greater impact on the international stage to reduce poverty and injustice. The name "Oxfam" comes from the Oxford Committee for Famine Relief, founded in Britain in 1942. The group campaigned for food supplies to be sent through an allied naval blockade to starving women and children in enemy-occupied Greece during the Second World War.As well as becoming a world leader in the delivery of emergency relief, Oxfam International implements long-term development programs in vulnerable communities. We are also part of a global movement, campaigning with others, for instance, to end unfair trade rules, demand better health and education services for all, and to combat climate change. Today, there are 17 member organizations of the Oxfam International confederation. They are based in: Australia, Belgium, Canada,France, Germany, Great Britain, Hong Kong, Ireland, India, Italy, Japan, Mexico, The Netherlands, New Zealand, Quebec, Spain and the United States. The Oxfam International Secretariat is based in Oxford, UK. The Secretariat runs advocacy offices in Brussels, Geneva, New York, Washington DC and Brasilia. Oxfam GB is an actor in the implementation of this project.
